result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Kurtis Cupery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked and the sentences are to be served, they are to be consecutive to each other and consecutive to any other sentence the defendant may be serving.  Court grants huber and the sentence may be served in another county.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Agent Pulice - defendant has paid the court costs in full.
Probation review hearing at 03-07-2016 01:00 pm

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
10:13 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 amended to Misdemeasnor Possession of THC and count 2 Misdemeanor Possession of Narcotic Drugs.  DA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to counts 1 & 2 as amended.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNTS 1 & 2 - 30 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

If served, the jail sentences are to be consecutive to each other and any other sentence the defendant may be serving.  Court grants huber and may be served in another county.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.

Court adjourned at 10:21 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-28-2015 10:00 am

3:29 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - has na offer and is acceptable and requests another date.  Court will set for plea &  sentencing on April 28, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 3:30 pm.
State's
Defendant's
for Discovery (Defendant's)
Status hearing at 04-20-2015 03:00 pm

10:06 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Court will set for Status Hearing on April 20, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 10:08 a.m.
Status hearing on March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
By Atty Barb Privat
Status hearing on March 10, 2015 at 09:00 am.

1:19 P.M.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - will be presenting the defendant.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 10, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:20 p.m.
Status hearing on January 26, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

1:30 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, attempted contacting one last week and has not heard back.  Court will set for status hearing in approx 3 weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:30 p.m.
Status hearing on January 5, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:14 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.   Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Barb Privat.


Attorney Privat confirms the defendant has received a copy of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  

Court orders bond set at $500 Signature Bond with the condition of:    Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Attorney Privat waives time limits on the preliminary hearing - believes the defendant may qualify for PD but not certain if he will be seeking PD representation.  Court instructs defendant of his right to an attorney.

Court orders Status Hearing, regarding counsel, be held in approximately three weeks.

Court adjourned at 1:16 p.m.
